text:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

Mr. Rufus bore the brunt in the last promotion examination.

options.A: Mr Rufus failed the examination woefully
options.B: Mr Rufus excelled in the examination
options.C: Mr. Rufus was excited about the examination
options.D: Mr. Rufus toyed with the examination

explanation:
bore the brunt;To suffer the worst part of an unpleasant or problematic situation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:

options.B: My friend is well known to people

well off;wealthy. (in a favourable situation or circumstances).

text:

text:

text:

text: Bola takes......his father both in appearance and his manner

text: .........rich has its own problem
explanation:

text:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s) 

The doctor listened to my heartbeat with a .........
explanation:
stethoscope; a medical instrument for listening to the action of someone's heart or breathing, typically having a small disc-shaped resonator that is placed against the chest, and two tubes connected to earpieces.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s) 

With strong determination, Adamu was able to .... the problem
explanation:
With strong determination, Adamu was able tosurmountthe problem
surmount means to overcome (a difficulty or obstacle).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s) 
It is impossible to say whether ......Ola and her sister will be offered jobs by the firm.
explanation:
It is impossible to say whetherbothOla and her sister will be offered jobs by the firm.
Both is used for emphasis to refer to two people or things, regarded and identified together.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s) 

He decided to wait for the bus because he had..........
explanation:
He decided to wait for the bus because he hada lot of luggage
The nounluggagecan be countable or uncountable. In more general, commonly used, contexts, thepluralform will also beluggage.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
